info.description:
## REST API for Delta Exchange
Find out more on [Delta Exchange Global](https://global.delta.exchange)
info.title: Delta Exchange Api V2

tags.name: Orders
tags.description: Placing Orders, Cancelling Orders, Placing batch orders, Cancelling batch orders, Get Open orders, Change Orders Leverage. Rate limits have been introduced recently that allows only set number of operations inside a matching engine in a timeframe. The current rate limits is 500 operations/sec for each product. For ex - placing 50 orders in a batch is equivalent to 50 operations as these orders will be processed by matching engine. Rate limits do not apply when cancelling orders.

tags.name: Positions
tags.description: Get Open positions, Change Position Margin, Close Position, Close All Position

tags.name: TradeHistory
tags.description: Get Orders History, Get Fill History

tags.name: Dead Man's Switch (Auto Cancel)
tags.description: Set up timers for auto orders cancel in case of network malfunctions

get.description: Indices refer to spot price indices that Delta Exchange creates by combining spot prices of prominent crypto exchanges. These indices form the underlying of futures and options contracts listed on Delta Exchange. All details of indices on Delta Exchange are available [here](https://global.delta.exchange/indices).

The endpoint provides details about all available trading products on the platform. Each product represents a financial instrument like perpetual futures, options, or contracts for specific asset pairs.

parameters.name: contract_types
parameters.description: Comma separated list of contract types e.g. futures,perpetual_futures,call_options, put_options, interest_rate_swaps,move_options,spreads, turbo_call_options, turbo_put_options, spot

parameters.name: states
parameters.description: Comma separated list of states e.g. upcoming,live,expired,settled to get expired contracts.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: after cursor for paginated request

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: before cursor for paginated request

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: size of a single page for paginated request, default: 100

get.description: The endpoint retrieves details of a specific product identified by its symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT, ETHUSDT).

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: symbol of the desired product like BTCUSD, ETHUSD

get.description: This endpoint retrieves the live tickers for available trading products, with an optional filter by specified contract types. The contract types should be provided as a comma-separated list (e.g., futures, perpetual_futures, call_options). If no contract type is specified, data for all available products will be returned.

parameters.name: contract_types
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of contract types to filter the tickers. Example values include futures, perpetual_futures, call_options, put_options, interest_rate_swaps, move_options, spreads, turbo_call_options, turbo_put_options, and spot.

200.description: List of live [tickers](#tocSticker) for all products, including implied volatility (IV) for option strikes.

get.summary: Get ticker for a product by symbol
get.description: This endpoint retrieves the ticker data for a specific product, identified by its symbol. The ticker data includes live price data, open interest, implied volatility (IV) for options, and other related market data.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The symbol of the product for which the ticker data is requested (e.g., BTCUSD, ETHUSD).

200.description: [Ticker](#tocSticker) data for the requested product, including implied volatility (IV) for option strikes, if applicable.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order which needs to be created. Rate limits apply.

200.description: Returns back the order object with assigned id and latest state

400.description: Returns [error](#place-order-error-description) if order could not be placed

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order which needs to be cancelled

400.description: Returns error if order could not be cancelled

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order which needs to be edited. Rate limits apply.

200.description: Returns back the order object with assigned id and latest state

400.description: Returns [error](#place-order-error-description) if order could not be placed

parameters.name: product_ids
parameters.description: comma separated product ids, if not specified, all the orders will be returned

parameters.name: states
parameters.description: comma separated list of states - open,pending

parameters.name: contract_types
parameters.description: comma separated list of desired contract types, if not specified any parameters then, all the orders will be returned

parameters.name: order_types
parameters.description: comma separated order types

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: from time in micro-seconds in epoc; referring to the order creation time

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: from time in micro-seconds in epoc; referring to the order creation time

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: after cursor for pagination; becomes null if page after the current one does not exist

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: before cursor for pagination; becomes null if page before the current one does not exist

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: number of records per page

200.description: List of orders as per the query

post.description: A bracket order is a set of TP and SL order. For a bracket order , size need not be specified as it closes the entire position. For a given contract, you can have multiple bracket orders for open orders but only a single bracket order for any open position.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Bracket Order which needs to be updated

400.description: Returns error if orders could not be updated

put.description: A bracket order is a set of TP and SL order. You can specify bracket order with an order that will create a new position. Use this api to change the bracket params attached with an order.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Bracket Order which needs to be updated

400.description: Returns error if orders could not be updated

delete.description: Cancels all orders for a given product id. If product id is not provided, it cancels orders for provided contract types. If none of them are provided, it cancels all the orders. Provide either product id or list of contract types at a time. If both are provided, contract types will be ignored.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Filters for selecting orders that needs to be cancelled

400.description: Returns error if orders could not be cancelled

post.description: Orders in a batch should belong to the same contract. Max allowed size limit in a batch is 50. Rate limits apply. Please note that ioc is not valid time in force values for creating batch orders.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Does not support time_in_force flag for orders, All orders in batch create are assumed to be gtc orders. batch create does not support stop orders, it support only limit orders

400.description: returns error if orders couldnt be placed

put.description: Orders to be edited in a batch. Rate limits apply.

400.description: returns error if orders couldnt be edited
returns error if orders couldnt be deleted

parameters.name: cancel after details
parameters.description: cancel after details

200.description: Returns back the cancel_after configs set

400.description: Returns if configs couldnt be set

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: Id of the order

200.description: Returns back the order object with assigned id and latest state

parameters.name: client_oid
parameters.description: Client provided order id

200.description: Returns back the order object with assigned client order id and latest state

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: Product id of the ordered product

get.description: Change in position may take upto 10secs to reflect. Use 'GET /position' for real-time data.

parameters.name: product_ids
parameters.description: comma separated product ids. If not specified any parameters, all the open positions will be returned

parameters.name: contract_types
parameters.description: comma separated list of desired contract types. If not specified any parameters then, all the open positions will be returned

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: id of the product

parameters.name: underlying_asset_symbol
parameters.description: Underlying asset symbol. e.g. 'BTC', 'ETH'. This gives a list of all positions in products which have the given underlying asset

200.description: Open position for the give product id

size.description: Position size, negative for short and positive for long

put.description: Changes position auto topup flag. Positions automatically inherits auto topup flag of the account. If account level auto topop is set to false, use this api to change auto topup flag for individual positions.

400.description: Returns error if position margin could not be changed

delta_margin.description: Delta in the position margin, positive in case of adding margin & negative in case of removing margin

400.description: Returns error if position margin could not be changed
Returns error if not able to close all positions

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: number of levels on each side

200.description: List of recent trades of the product
List of wallets attached to the user account

parameters.description: comma separated list of asset_ids for which to get txns logs

parameters.description: transaction types to retrieve

200.description: csv of transactions for that wallet

post.description: This api transfers asset from one subaccount to another subaccount or to the main/parent account. Please ensure that the subaccounts involved in the transfer should belong to the same parent account. Requests to transfer assets across subaccounts that belong to different parent accounts will fail. Please make sure that the api key used to make this api request belongs to the main/parent account.

get.description: This api returns the wallet balance transfers for subaccounts belonging to the parent/main account of an api user. Make sure you are calling this api from the main account. If no subaccount is mentioned in the request, data for all the subacounts will be returned. Use page size to get more entries in a single request.

parameters.name: states
parameters.description: Comma separated list of states e.g. to get expired contracts https://api.delta.exchange/v2/products?contract_types=call_options&states=expired

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: size of a single page for paginated request, default: 100

get.description: It returns historical Open-High-Low-Close(ohlc) candles data of the symbol as per input values for resolution, start time and end time. Also, it can return only upto 2000 candles maximum in a response.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: ohlc candle time frames like 1m, 5m, 1h

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: To get funding history pass symbol as FUNDING:${symbol}, mark price MARK:${symbol} and OI data OI:${symbol} for e.g. - FUNDING:BTCUSD, MARK:C-BTC-66400-010824, OI:ETHUSD

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start time: unix timestamp in seconds

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End time: unix timestamp in seconds

parameters.name: symbols
parameters.description: comma separated product symbols

200.description: sum of turnover in the last 7 and 30 days along with  Total Volume in the last 24 hours (in USD)

put.description: Channel provides updates when MMP is triggered. Market maker protection is available to registered market makers by default. Others can reach out to support for getting access to MMP. More info [here](https://guides.delta.exchange/delta-exchange-user-guide/market-makers-guide/market-maker-protection).

parameters.name: mmp_config
parameters.description: mmp config for a given underlying asset

200.description: Returns back the User Preference which contains mmp config

400.description: Returns error if mmp is not enabled on the account

parameters.name: reset_mmp
parameters.description: reset mmp config for a given underlying asset

200.description: Returns back the User Preference which contains mmp config

400.description: Returns error if mmp is not enabled on the account

200.description: User trading preferences attached to the account

parameters.name: trading_preferences
parameters.description: trading preferences

200.description: User trading preferences attached to the account

get.description: This api returns all the subaccounts belonging to the same parent/main user. Make sure to call this api from the parent user.

200.description: Subaccounts belonging to the same parent account.

get.description: This api returns the user object.

symbol.description: Symbol representing the index, typically prefixed by '.DE' followed by base asset and quoting asset.

weight.description: Weight of the exchange in the index.

constituent_exchanges.description: Details of constituent exchanges, including their names and weights in the index.

underlying_asset_id.description: ID of the underlying asset for the index.

quoting_asset_id.description: ID of the quoting asset for the index.

tick_size.description: Precision of the spot price in decimal format.

Index.description: Details of an index used in trading, including its constituents and characteristics.

funding_clamp_value.description: The maximum allowable funding rate clamp value.

only_reduce_only_orders_allowed.description: Indicates whether only reduce-only orders are allowed.

tags.description: Tags associated with the product specifications.

ProductSpecs.description: Specifications related to the specific product or contract.

precision.description: Number of decimal places supported for the asset.

deposit_status.description: Indicates if deposits are enabled for the asset.

withdrawal_status.description: Indicates if withdrawals are enabled for the asset.

base_withdrawal_fee.description: Fixed withdrawal fee for the asset.

min_withdrawal_amount.description: Minimum allowable withdrawal amount for the asset.

Asset.description: Details of the asset used in the product or contract.

id.description: Unique identifier of a product or contract.

symbol.description: Symbol of the product or contract like BTCUSD, ETHUSD.

description.description: Detailed description of the product or contract.
description.example: Bitcoin Perpetual futures, quoted, settled & margined in US Dollar

created_at.description: Creation timestamp of the product or contract.

updated_at.description: Last update timestamp of the product or contract.

impact_size.description: Size of a typical trade used for mark price computation.

initial_margin.description: Margin required to open a position.

maintenance_margin.description: Minimum margin required to maintain a position.

contract_value.description: Notional value of the contract (spot price x contract amount).

contract_unit_currency.description: Unit of the contract (underlying asset or settling asset).

tick_size.description: Minimum price interval between two successive prices.

max_leverage_notional.description: Maximum notional position size at the highest leverage.

default_leverage.description: Default leverage assigned to the product.

liquidation_penalty_factor.description: Factor used to calculate liquidation penalty.

position_size_limit.description: Maximum size for a single contract order.

is_quanto.description: Indicates if the contract is quanto.

price_band.description: Price range allowed around the mark price (percentage).

spot_index.description: Spot index used for the product.

ProductCategories.description: List of all the product category names on delta exchange. Please refer to this list while subscribing to various public and private channels on delta exchange websocket

unfilled_size.description: Order size which is not filled yet

side.description: Side for which to place order

limit_price.description: Price level on which order must be triggered

stop_order_type.description: Stop order type - stop loss or take profit

stop_price.description: Stop price level for the stop order

reduce_only.description: if set, will only close positions. New orders will not be placed

client_order_id.description: client order id provided by the user while creating order

created_at.description: Created at unix timestamp of the order in micro seconds

product_id.description: Product id of the ordered product

product_symbol.description: Product symbol of the ordered product

product_id.description: Only one of either product_id or product_symbol must be sent.

product_symbol.description: Only one of either product_id or product_symbol must be sent.

order_type.description: Limit order(limit_price must be defined) or Market order

stop_order_type.description: Stop order type - stop loss or take profit

stop_price.description: Stop loss price level if the order is stop order

trail_amount.description: Use trail amount if you want a trailing stop order. Required if stop price is empty.

bracket_stop_loss_limit_price.description: Bracket order stop loss limit price

bracket_stop_loss_price.description: Bracket order stop loss trigger price

bracket_trail_amount.description: use bracket trail amount if you want a trailing stop order. Required if bracket stop price is empty

bracket_take_profit_limit_price.description: Bracket order take profit limit price

bracket_take_profit_price.description: take profit trigger price for bracket order

mmp.description: MMP level for the order - disabled/mmp1/mmp2/mmp3/mmp4/mmp5

reduce_only.description: if set, will only close positions. New orders will not be placed

client_order_id.description: client order id provided by the user while creating order

cancel_orders_accepted.description: if set, will cancel all existing orders for the product

order_type.description: Limit order(limit_price must be defined) or Market order

mmp.description: MMP level for the order - disabled/mmp1/mmp2/mmp3/mmp4/mmp5

trail_amount.description: Use trail amount if you want a trailing stop order. Required if stop price is empty.

order_type.description: Limit order(limit_price must be defined) or Market order

trail_amount.description: Use trail amount if you want a trailing stop order. Required if stop price is empty.

order_type.description: Limit order(limit_price must be defined) or Market order

bracket_stop_trigger_method.description: stop order trigger method for bracket orders- mark_price/last_traded_price/spot_price

id.description: Order ID for which bracket params are being updated

product_id.description: Only one of either product_id or product_symbol must be sent.

product_symbol.description: Only one of either product_id or product_symbol must be sent.

bracket_stop_loss_limit_price.description: stop loss limit price for bracket order

bracket_stop_loss_price.description: stop loss trigger price for bracket order

bracket_take_profit_price.description: take profit trigger price for bracket order

id.description: use bracket trail amount if you want a trailing stop order. Required if bracket stop price is empty

client_order_id.description: client order id provided by the user while creating order

product_id.description: product_id of the product in the order
Only one of either product_id or product_symbol must be sent.

contract_types.description: comma separated list of desired contract types

cancel_limit_orders.description: set true to cancel open limit orders

cancel_stop_orders.description: set as true to cancel stop orders

cancel_reduce_only_orders.description: set as true to cancel reduce only orders

product_id.description: Only one of either product_id or product_symbol must be sent.

product_symbol.description: Only one of either product_id or product_symbol must be sent.

size.description: Position size, negative for short and positive for long

realized_pnl.description: Net realized pnl since the position was opened

realized_funding.description: Net realized funding since the position was opened

price.description: Price at which the fill happened, BigDecimal sent as string

commission.description: Commission paid on this fill, negative value means commission was earned because of maker role

order_id.description: Will be order_id(Integer) in most cases. Will be UUID string of order when fill_type is settlement

leverage.description: Leverage of all open orders for this product

order_margin.description: Margin blocked in open orders for this product

product_id.description: Product id of the ordered product

depth.description: sum of size till that price level

size.description: for derivatives -> number of contracts, for spot -> amount in underlying

depth.description: sum of size till that price level

size.description: for derivatives -> number of contracts, for spot -> amount in underlying

blocked_margin.description: Total blocked margin including commissions for all modes

cross_asset_liability.description: Asset liability in Cross margin mode

cross_commission.description: Commision blocked in Cross margin mode

cross_locked_collateral.description: collateral blocked in Cross margin mode

cross_order_margin.description: margin blocked for open orders in Cross margin mode

cross_position_margin.description: margin blocked for open positions in Cross margin mode

order_margin.description: margin blocked for open positions in isolated mode

portfolio_margin.description: Total margin blocked including commissions in portfolio margin mode

position_margin.description: Margin blocked in open positions in isolated mode

user_id.description: User Id linked to this wallet

ArrayOfWallets.description: Array of wallet for every asset

amount.description: Amount to transfer. Only postive values allowed.
amount credited/debited in this transaction (+ for credited, - for debited)

balance.description: net wallet balance after this transaction

transferrer_user_id.description: User id of the account debited with the asset.

transferee_user_id.description: User id of the account credited with the asset.

delta.description: The rate of change of the option price with respect to changes in the underlying asset price. A measure of sensitivity to the asset price movement.

gamma.description: The rate of change of delta with respect to changes in the underlying asset price. A measure of the curvature of the options price sensitivity to the asset price.

rho.description: The rate of change of the option price with respect to changes in the risk-free interest rate. A measure of interest rate sensitivity.

theta.description: The rate of change of the option price with respect to time, often referred to as time decay. A measure of how the option's price declines as expiration approaches.

vega.description: The rate of change of the option price with respect to changes in the volatility of the underlying asset. A measure of volatility sensitivity.

greeks.description: The Greeks represent different factors that influence the pricing of options. These are key measures for assessing risk and managing option positions.

lower_limit.description: The minimum price limit for the product. It defines the lowest allowable price before triggering a price band constraint.

upper_limit.description: The maximum price limit for the product. It defines the highest allowable price before triggering a price band constraint.

price_band.description: The price band defines the permissible price range for a product. The lower and upper limits represent the boundaries within which the product's price can fluctuate.

ask_iv.description: The implied volatility (IV) for the ask price. Represents the market's expectation of the future volatility of the underlying asset.

ask_size.description: The size of the ask order, representing the quantity of the asset available for sale at the ask price.

best_ask.description: The best (lowest) ask price available in the market for the asset.

best_bid.description: The best (highest) bid price available in the market for the asset.

bid_iv.description: The implied volatility (IV) for the bid price. Represents the market's expectation of future volatility for the bid side of the order book.

bid_size.description: The size of the bid order, representing the quantity of the asset that buyers are willing to purchase at the bid price.

quotes.description: The 'quotes' object contains the latest bid and ask prices, their respective implied volatilities (IV), and order sizes for an asset. It provides key market data for understanding liquidity and pricing.

close.description: The closing price of the last trade for the product.

contract_type.description: Comma-separated list of contract types, such as futures, perpetual_futures, call_options, put_options, interest_rate_swaps, move_options, spreads, turbo_call_options, turbo_put_options, and spot.

greeks.description: The Greek values for options associated with the ticker, including delta, gamma, vega, theta, and rho.

high.description: The highest price reached during the trading session.

low.description: The lowest price reached during the trading session.

mark_price.description: The market price of the product, reflecting the most recent transaction.

mark_vol.description: The market volume at the most recent trade price.

oi.description: The open interest, or the number of outstanding contracts, for the product.

oi_value.description: The value of the open interest in the base currency.

oi_value_symbol.description: The symbol representing the currency of the open interest value.

oi_value_usd.description: The open interest value converted to USD.

open.description: The opening price at the start of the trading session.

price_band.description: The price band within which the products price can fluctuate during the trading session.

product_id.description: A unique identifier for the product.

quotes.description: The latest bid and ask prices, sizes, and implied volatilities for the product.

size.description: The size of the most recent order executed in the market.

spot_price.description: The current spot price of the underlying asset.

strike_price.description: The strike price for options contracts associated with the product.

symbol.description: The ticker symbol for the product.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the last trade or update to the ticker.

turnover.description: The total turnover (value traded) for the product during the trading session.

turnover_symbol.description: The symbol representing the currency in which the turnover is measured.

turnover_usd.description: The turnover value converted to USD.

volume.description: The total trading volume for the product during the trading session.

Ticker.description: The 'Ticker' object provides real-time trading data for a specific product, including prices, volumes, open interest, and Greek values (for options). This data is essential for analyzing market trends and asset performance.

after.description: after cursor for pagination; becomes null if page after the current one does not exist

before.description: before cursor for pagination; becomes null if page before the current one does not exist

additionalProperties.description: array of timestamp and closing value

last_30_days_volume.description: sum of turnover usd in the last 30 days

last_7_days_volume.description: sum of turnover usd in the last 7 days

total_volume.description: sum of turnover usd in the last 24 hours

freeze_interval.description: MMP freeze interval in seconds. Setting this to zero will require a manual reset once mmp is triggered.

trade_limit.description: Notional trade limit for mmp to trigger (in USD)

delta_limit.description: Delta Adjusted notional trade limit for mmp to trigger (in USD)

vega_limit.description: vega traded limit for mmp to trigger (in USD)

mmp.description: Specify mmp flag for the config update

default_auto_topup.description: Default auto top-up setting for newly acquired positions (only for isolated mode)

mmp_config.description: Config object for market maker protection (only for MMP-enabled accounts)

deto_for_commission.description: Flag to determine whether to pay commissions in DETO

vip_level.description: VIP level for this account. Customers get better fee discounting for higher VIP levels

vip_discount_factor.description: Discount factor based on the VIP level

price_alert_assets.description: Assets for which price alerts are set

interest_credit.description: Whether the user is receiving interest credits

default_auto_topup.description: Default auto top-up setting for newly acquired positions

showMarketOrdersForOptionsInBracket.description: Flag to display market orders for options in bracket orders

interest_credit.description: Whether the user is receiving interest credits

cancel_after.description: Timer value in milliseconds after which orders are to be cancelled. To disable deadman switch and keep your orders open, set cancel_after to 0.

cancel_after_timestamp.description: timestamp after which orders will get cancelled

pf_index_symbol.description: Portfolio index symbol if account is at portfolio margin mode.
